businessProfile.name: Capo's Restaurant and Speakeasy
businessProfile.address: 5675 W Sahara Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89146, USA
businessProfile.formatted_address: 5675 W Sahara Ave, Las Vegas, NV 89146, USA

reviews.text:
We went to Capo‚Äôs Italian Speakeasy for my birthday, and it was an incredible experience from start to finish. The atmosphere was fun and unique, with live entertainment the night we visited, an Elvis/Tom Jones impersonator that really added to the vibe.

The food? Absolutely phenomenal. Hands down the best Italian food I‚Äôve ever had. It doesn‚Äôt even compare to chain restaurants like Olive Garden, it‚Äôs on a whole different level. The arugula salad was fresh and flavorful, the chicken marsala was amazing, and the cucumber martini was the best martini I‚Äôve ever had.

Our waiter and the entire staff were wonderful, attentive, kind, fun and made the evening feel special. I‚Äôd give this place 5 stars without hesitation and would absolutely come back next time I‚Äôm in Vegas.

The only downside? They don't have a location in my home state!

We came for dinner. Heard so many good things about this place and how the atmosphere was great. We get here. Loved how you ring the doorbell to even get in. We walked in. They put us in the corner table where my husband couldn‚Äôt see the entertainment. Asked our waiter if we can move tables , he said there were no tables. Then a few minutes later, a couple came in and sat at a 4 seat table. Order a drink with lime.  They bring lemon. Ordered a salad with no tomatoes.  I got tomatoes. Main meal was good.  I‚Äôm sure this is a great place for others‚Ä¶I just was not impressed.

Really had a great time took pictures of the menu, but forgot to take pictures of our food. It was just that good authentic taste of Italy.  This is definitely a must try for everyone young and old. The atmosphere was great as well as we were entertained by there lounge act. He was really good. Will definitely be back, I have to try the desserts next time . Thanks for the experience and the hospitality.

What a breath of fresh air this was in Vegas! It felt like a place in Chicago or New York. Speakeasy entrance, excellent service and the singer was amazing. Let‚Äôs not forget the food and drinks which were great! Super place to celebrate birthdays as the singer will come to your table and get everyone in the restaurant to sing HB üéâ

It was a good overall experience.  I get its  Vegas and things are supposed to be fun but I‚Äôm not a huge fan of the speakeasy concept or having to wait in the heat for someone to let me in.  My focus is on the food.  Some people might enjoy the speakeasy concept and entertainment aspects of this place much more than me.  The place is cool looking and kept a little dark.  The host and staff were friendly, and the food came out quick.  The food was good, not great.  Ma‚Äôs meatball and sausage was a unique dish.  It had some spicy sauce that had a lot of flavor.  The meatball was above average, but not exceptional..  The sausage was probably the best part of the meal.  It was authentic Italian sausage that was juicy and had a zesty flavor.  Santucci‚Äôs spaghetti was okay.  The red sauce is good, but not great.  It came with a full piece of sausage.  The portion sizes are massive so think about sharing.  They had a Sinatra style singer playing in the lounge and taking requests, which was a nice touch.  You could still have a conversation at the table.  My major complaint is the tables to the side of the bar are situated so you are eerily and uncomfortably close to the people on the other side of the wall in the dining room.  If you turn your head, you are staring in someone‚Äôs face.  The prices are on the low end.  I would probably go back because they really did try to make sure we had a great and fun experience.

editorial_summary.overview: Chicago Mob-themed throwback with a secret entrance providing Italian specialties in dark surrounds.

recentReviews.author: JMC C
recentReviews.text: We came for dinner. Heard so many good things about this place and how the atmosphere was great. We get here. Loved how you ring the doorbell to even get in. We walked in. They put us in the corner table where my husband couldn‚Äôt see the entertainment. Asked our waiter if we can move tables , he said there were no tables. Then a few minutes later, a couple came in and sat at a 4 seat table. Order a drink with lime.  They bring lemon. Ordered a salad with no tomatoes.  I got tomatoes. Main meal was good.  I‚Äôm sure this is a great place for others‚Ä¶I just was not impressed.

recentReviews.author: Luca
recentReviews.text: What a breath of fresh air this was in Vegas! It felt like a place in Chicago or New York. Speakeasy entrance, excellent service and the singer was amazing. Let‚Äôs not forget the food and drinks which were great! Super place to celebrate birthdays as the singer will come to your table and get everyone in the restaurant to sing HB üéâ

recentReviews.author: Tiffany
recentReviews.text:
We went to Capo‚Äôs Italian Speakeasy for my birthday, and it was an incredible experience from start to finish. The atmosphere was fun and unique, with live entertainment the night we visited, an Elvis/Tom Jones impersonator that really added to the vibe.

The food? Absolutely phenomenal. Hands down the best Italian food I‚Äôve ever had. It doesn‚Äôt even compare to chain restaurants like Olive Garden, it‚Äôs on a whole different level. The arugula salad was fresh and flavorful, the chicken marsala was amazing, and the cucumber martini was the best martini I‚Äôve ever had.

Our waiter and the entire staff were wonderful, attentive, kind, fun and made the evening feel special. I‚Äôd give this place 5 stars without hesitation and would absolutely come back next time I‚Äôm in Vegas.

The only downside? They don't have a location in my home state!

recentReviews.author: Jason Bruno
recentReviews.text: It was a good overall experience.  I get its  Vegas and things are supposed to be fun but I‚Äôm not a huge fan of the speakeasy concept or having to wait in the heat for someone to let me in.  My focus is on the food.  Some people might enjoy the speakeasy concept and entertainment aspects of this place much more than me.  The place is cool looking and kept a little dark.  The host and staff were friendly, and the food came out quick.  The food was good, not great.  Ma‚Äôs meatball and sausage was a unique dish.  It had some spicy sauce that had a lot of flavor.  The meatball was above average, but not exceptional..  The sausage was probably the best part of the meal.  It was authentic Italian sausage that was juicy and had a zesty flavor.  Santucci‚Äôs spaghetti was okay.  The red sauce is good, but not great.  It came with a full piece of sausage.  The portion sizes are massive so think about sharing.  They had a Sinatra style singer playing in the lounge and taking requests, which was a nice touch.  You could still have a conversation at the table.  My major complaint is the tables to the side of the bar are situated so you are eerily and uncomfortably close to the people on the other side of the wall in the dining room.  If you turn your head, you are staring in someone‚Äôs face.  The prices are on the low end.  I would probably go back because they really did try to make sure we had a great and fun experience.

recentReviews.author: Charles Howell
recentReviews.text: Really had a great time took pictures of the menu, but forgot to take pictures of our food. It was just that good authentic taste of Italy.  This is definitely a must try for everyone young and old. The atmosphere was great as well as we were entertained by there lounge act. He was really good. Will definitely be back, I have to try the desserts next time . Thanks for the experience and the hospitality.

customerMoodAnalysis.sentimentSummary: Customers have positive experiences overall. Your 4.4/5 rating from 5 recent reviews shows solid satisfaction with room for growth.

strengthsPerceived: Customers love the unique and fun atmosphere with live entertainment, such as the Elvis/Tom Jones impersonator and Sinatra-style singer, which adds to the overall dining experience. - social media marketing can showcase this strength

The food is described as phenomenal, with specific praise for dishes like the arugula salad, chicken marsala, and authentic Italian sausage, setting it apart from chain restaurants. - SEO services can leverage this for better visibility
The staff is consistently praised for being attentive, kind, and making the evening feel special, enhancing the overall customer experience. - review management can highlight this positive aspect
improvementOpportunities: Seating issues and table arrangement concerns - review management can address this concern
Lack of awareness about the speakeasy concept and ambiance - social media marketing can improve this area
Incorrect orders and service inconsistencies - review management can address this concern

recommendations.title: Generate More Reviews
recommendations.description: Encourage satisfied customers to leave reviews
